intro: Schismatoclada concinna, commonly known as the narrowleaf burrobrush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and rocky soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and the leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs. Schismatoclada concinna plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various desert organisms.
